author: Staff Reporter
text:
M. Seetharaman, who retired in 1991 as an Assistant Editor after serving The Hindu for around 20 years, passed away at his home in Abhiramapuram on Thursday. He was 89.

At the editorial desk, he was known as a straight-talking stickler for language and usage, and as a mentor to younger colleagues.

Prior to joining The Hindu , he was with The Mail newspaper for about 25 years on the editorial desk.

He is survived by his son and two daughters.
title: Former journalist dead
